slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः | दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhrī-bhagavān uvācha | abhayaṁ sattva-sanśhuddhir jñāna-yoga-vyavasthitiḥ | dānaṁ damaśh cha yajñaśh cha svādhyāyas tapa ārjavam ||
slokas.meaning: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: Fearlessness; purification of one's existence; cultivation of spiritual knowledge; charity; self-control; performance of sacrifice; study of the Vedas; austerity; simplicity;

slokas.sanskrit: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् | दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: ahinsā satyam akrodhas tyāgaḥ śhāntir apaiśhunam | dayā bhūteṣhv aloluptvaṁ mārdavaṁ hrīr achāpalam ||
slokas.meaning: Nonviolence; truthfulness; freedom from anger; renunciation; tranquility; aversion to faultfinding; compassion for all living entities; freedom from covetousness; gentleness; modesty; steady determination;

slokas.sanskrit: तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता | भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ||
slokas.pronunciation: tejaḥ kṣhamā dhṛitiḥ śhaucham adroho nātimānitā | bhavanti sampadaṁ daivīm abhijātasya bhārata ||
slokas.meaning: Vigor; forgiveness; fortitude; cleanliness; and freedom from envy and from the passion for honor – these transcendental qualities, O son of Bharata, belong to godly men endowed with divine nature.

slokas.sanskrit: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च | अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: dambho darpo 'bhimānaśh cha krodhaḥ pāruṣhyam eva cha | ajñānaṁ chābhijātasya pārtha sampadam āsurīm ||
slokas.meaning: Pride, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness and ignorance – these qualities belong to those of demoniac nature, O son of Pritha.

slokas.sanskrit: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता | मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ||
slokas.pronunciation: daivī sampad vimokṣhāya nibandhāyāsurī matā | mā śhuchaḥ sampadaṁ daivīm abhijāto 'si pāṇḍava ||
slokas.meaning: The transcendental qualities are conducive to liberation, whereas the demoniac qualities make for bondage. Do not worry, O son of Pandu, for you are born with the divine qualities.

slokas.sanskrit: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च | दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ||
slokas.pronunciation: dvau bhūta-sargau loke 'smin daiva āsura eva cha | daivo vistaraśhaḥ prokta āsuraṁ pārtha me śhṛiṇu ||
slokas.meaning: O son of Pritha, in this world there are two kinds of created beings. One is called divine and the other demoniac. I have already explained to you at length the divine qualities. Now hear from Me about the demoniac.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः | न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: pravṛittiṁ cha nivṛittiṁ cha janā na vidur āsurāḥ | na śhauchaṁ nāpi chāchāro na satyaṁ teṣhu vidyate ||
slokas.meaning: Those who are demoniac do not know what is to be done and what is not to be done. Neither cleanliness nor proper behavior nor truth is found in them.

slokas.sanskrit: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् | अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: asatyam apratiṣhṭhaṁ te jagad āhur anīśhvaram | aparaspara-sambhūtaṁ kim anyat kāma-haitukam ||
slokas.meaning: They say that this world is unreal, with no foundation, no God in control. They say it is produced of sex desire and has no cause other than lust.

slokas.sanskrit: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः | प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: etāṁ dṛiṣhṭim avaṣhṭabhya naṣhṭātmāno 'lpa-buddhayaḥ | prabhavanty ugra-karmāṇaḥ kṣhayāya jagato 'hitāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Following such conclusions, the demoniac, who are lost to themselves and who have no intelligence, engage in unbeneficial, horrible works meant to destroy the world.

slokas.sanskrit: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः | मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: kāmam āśhritya duṣhpūraṁ dambha-māna-madānvitāḥ | mohād gṛihītvāsad-grāhān pravartante 'śhuchi-vratāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Taking shelter of insatiable lust and absorbed in the conceit of pride and false prestige, the demoniac, thus illusioned, are always sworn to unclean work, attracted by the impermanent.

slokas.sanskrit: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः | कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: chintām aparimeyāṁ cha pralayāntām upāśhritāḥ | kāmopabhoga-paramā etāvad iti niśhchitāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: They believe that to gratify the senses is the prime necessity of human civilization. Thus until the end of life their anxiety is immeasurable. Bound by a network of hundreds of thousands of desires and absorbed in lust and anger,

slokas.sanskrit: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः | ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ||
slokas.pronunciation: āśhā-pāśha-śhatair baddhāḥ kāma-krodha-parāyaṇāḥ | īhante kāma-bhogārtham anyāyenārtha-sañchayān ||
slokas.meaning: they secure money by illegal means for sense gratification.

slokas.sanskrit: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् | इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: idam adya mayā labdham imaṁ prāpsye manoratham | idam astīdam api me bhaviṣhyati punar dhanam ||
slokas.meaning: The demoniac person thinks: 'So much wealth do I have today, and I will gain more according to my schemes. So much is mine now, and it will increase in the future, more and more.'

slokas.sanskrit: असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि | ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ||
slokas.pronunciation: asau mayā hataḥ śhatrur haniṣhye chāparān api | īśhvaro 'ham ahaṁ bhogī siddho 'haṁ balavān sukhī ||
slokas.meaning: 'That enemy has been slain by me, and I shall slay others too! I am the lord of everything. I am the enjoyer. I am perfect, powerful and happy.'

slokas.sanskrit: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया | यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: āḍhyo 'bhijanavān asmi ko 'nyo 'sti sadṛiśho mayā | yakṣhye dāsyāmi modiṣhya ity ajñāna-vimohitāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: 'I am rich and born in a noble family. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices, I shall give charity, and thus I shall rejoice.' In this way, such persons are deluded by ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः | प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ||
slokas.pronunciation: aneka-chitta-vibhrāntā moha-jāla-samāvṛitāḥ | prasaktāḥ kāma-bhogeṣhu patanti narake 'śhuchau ||
slokas.meaning: Thus perplexed by various anxieties and bound by a network of illusions, they become too strongly attached to sense enjoyment and fall down into hell.

slokas.sanskrit: आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः | यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: ātma-sambhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhana-māna-madānvitāḥ | yajante nāma-yajñais te dambhenāvidhi-pūrvakam ||
slokas.meaning: Self-complacent and always impudent, deluded by wealth and false prestige, they sometimes proudly perform sacrifices in name only, without following any rules or regulations.

slokas.sanskrit: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः | मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः ||
slokas.pronunciation: ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ cha sanśhritāḥ | mām ātma-para-deheṣhu pradviṣhanto 'bhyasūyakāḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Bewildered by false ego, strength, pride, lust and anger, the demons become envious of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is situated in their own bodies and in the bodies of others, and blaspheme against the real religion.

slokas.sanskrit: तानहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् | क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ||
slokas.pronunciation: tān ahaṁ dviṣhataḥ krūrān sansāreṣhu narādhamān | kṣhipāmy ajasram aśhubhān āsurīṣhv eva yoniṣhu ||
slokas.meaning: Those who are envious and mischievous, who are the lowest among men, I perpetually cast into the ocean of material existence, into various demoniac species of life.

slokas.sanskrit: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि | मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: āsurīṁ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani | mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṁ gatim ||
slokas.meaning: Attaining repeated birth amongst the species of demoniac life, O son of Kunti, such persons can never approach Me. Gradually they sink down to the most abominable type of existence.

slokas.sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः | कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ||
slokas.pronunciation: tri-vidhaṁ narakasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśhanam ātmanaḥ | kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet ||
slokas.meaning: There are three gates leading to this hell – lust, anger and greed. Every sane man should give these up, for they lead to the degradation of the soul.

slokas.sanskrit: एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः | आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: etair vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamo-dvārais tribhir naraḥ | ācharaty ātmanaḥ śhreyas tato yāti parāṁ gatim ||
slokas.meaning: The man who has escaped these three gates of hell, O son of Kunti, performs acts conducive to self-realization and thus gradually attains the supreme destination.

slokas.sanskrit: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः | न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: yaḥ śhāstra-vidhim utsṛijya vartate kāma-kārataḥ | na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṁ na parāṁ gatim ||
slokas.meaning: He who discards scriptural injunctions and acts according to his own whims attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme destination.

slokas.sanskrit: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ | ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ||
slokas.pronunciation: tasmāch chhāstraṁ pramāṇaṁ te kāryākārya-vyavasthitau | jñātvā śhāstra-vidhānoktaṁ karma kartum ihārhasi ||
slokas.meaning: One should therefore understand what is duty and what is not duty by the regulations of the scriptures. Knowing such rules and regulations, one should act so that he may gradually be elevated.
